diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient experienced acute onset periumbilical pain that migrated to the right lower quadrant, accompanied by nausea, vomiting, subjective fevers, and chills. The physical exam revealed tenderness in the right lower quadrant and positive Rovsing's sign. CT imaging showed a dilated and fluid-filled appendix measuring 1.3 cm with mucosal hyperenhancement and surrounding inflammation, consistent with acute appendicitis, without evidence of perforation.
